content: siberian winter set the set is a simple slouchy beanie and a cowl worked in brioche stitch by elena byzova sizes average adult to fit head sizes 55-58 cm / 21-23 yarn drops air 70% alpaca 23% polyamide 7% wool 150m / 164 yards per 50g ball to make this set you would need 4 5 balls in total if you want to make the hat only - 2 balls needles for the hat - 3 75 mm us 5 circular needle 40 cm / 16 long or long circular needles for magic loop set of dpn of the same size to knit the crown if you are not using magic loop method for the cowl - 4 5 mm us 7 circular needle 60 cm / 24 long or longer it doesn t really matter the cowl is worked flat not in the round gauge 17 stitches x 38 row in 10 cm / 4 in stockinette stitch additional tools 4 stitch markers 1 in alternate color tapestry needle smooth waste yarn a hook if you are going to do the provisional cast-on with it construction notes ● hat is worked from the bottom up in circle ● hat is double-sided this is actually 2 hats worked separately in different directions from one starting row ● cowl is worked flat and then sewed together directions with waste yarn cast on 84 stitches using provisional cast-on method begin round 1 in stockinette stitch with your working yarn place a marker and join in the round without twisting knit in stockinette stitch for 89 rounds in total if you want slouch exactly like in the picture you can decrease or increase the number of rounds depends on how slouchy you want the hat to be round 90 *knit 21 stitches pm* 3 times knit 21 stitches ​ now you have 4 markers in your round one of which indicates the begging of the round it s better to use a marker in alternate color to indicate the beginning-of-round crown shaping round 1 decrease round *k1 k2tog knit until 3 stitches before next marker ssk k1 slip marker* 4 times round 2 knit all stitches ​ repeat these 2 rounds - switching to dpns when necessary - until 5 stitches remain between each marker next row *k1 knit 3 together k1* 4 times break yarn leaving a tail with your tapestry needle thread yarn tail through the remaining live stitches twice and pull tightly one hat is done it s time to make another one remove waste yarn from the cast on row you will have live stitches at your hat brim put these stitches on the needles mark the beginning row so you could count row later make one more hat to other direction weave in ends attach a pompom to the top of the hat if desired to knit the cowl with waste yarn cast on 50 stitches using provisional cast-on method first row *k1 p1* till the end of
